doc.after: Like many species of the genus Suillus, S.Â brevipes is edible, and the mushroom is considered choice by some.[17] The odor is mild, and the taste mild or slightly acidic.[10] Field guides typically recommended to remove the slimy cap cuticle, and, in older specimens, the tube layer before consumption.[10][18] The mushrooms are common in the diet of grizzly bears in Yellowstone National Park.[19]
